To the chief Musician, Altaschith, A Psalm <FI>or<Fi> Song of Asaph. Unto thee, O God, do we give thanks, <FI>unto thee<Fi> do we give thanks: for <FI>that<Fi> thy name is near thy wondrous works declare.<RF>Altaschith: or, Destroy not<Rf><RF>of: or, for<Rf>
When I shall receive the congregation I will judge uprightly.<RF>receiveâ€¦: or, take a set time<Rf>
The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved: I bear up the pillars of it. Selah.
I said unto the fools, Deal not foolishly: and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn:
Lift not up your horn on high: speak <FI>not with<Fi> a stiff neck.<CM>
For promotion <FI>cometh<Fi> neither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the south.<RF>south: Heb. desert<Rf>
But God <FI>is<Fi> the judge: he putteth down one, and setteth up another.

For in the hand of the LORD <FI>there is<Fi> a cup, and the wine is red; it is full of mixture; and he poureth out of the same: but the dregs thereof, all the wicked of the earth shall wring <FI>them<Fi> out, <FI>and<Fi> drink <FI>them<Fi>.
But I will declare for ever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off; <FI>but<Fi> the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.<CM>
